predicate.note: Frames file for 'end' based on survey of initial 100 or so sentences from big corpus. No related verbs yet surveyed.

roleset.name: cause to stop
roleset.note: might be TMP if a time period is ending, might be EXT if some financial thing is the Arg1, might be LOC if it's a spatial thing ending, perhaps MNR also

example.name: accusative, arg1 as pro-controlled S
example.text: The courts want *trace=courts* to end rigid affirmative action programs.

example.name: accusative, arg1 NP
example.text: Such a countermove could end Jaguar's hopes for independence.

example.name: ergative
example.text: The huge bronze bells...end, surprisingly, in the inverted position.

example.name: different kind of instrument
example.text: The first two GAF trials ended in mistrials earlier this year.

roleset.name: terminate

role.descr: up, down, or unchanged, or degree of change

roleset.note: in this corpus, primarily of stocks

example.name: arg1 as subj, arg2 as PP
example.text: Sea Containers would end up with a cash surplus of approx. $620 million.
example.arg: with a cash surplus of approx. $620 million

example.name: arg2 as subj, arg1 as PP
example.text: That data could end up in the hands of prosecutors

example.name: arg1 as subj, arg2 as PRD
example.text: Time Warner and Sony Corp could end up becoming partners.
